summary: We reviewed the Department of Education's data on school police and the arrest rates of students of different races in the nation's K-12 schools. Students' race and ethnicity, gender, and disability status mattered when it came to rates of arrest and referrals to police. title: K-12 Education: Differences in Student Arrest Rates Widen when Race, Gender, and Disability Status Overlap
